argument.desc: Path to file.
argument.name: file_name

command.desc:
This command is used to read an on-board configuration file that may be used to update any AFSW parameters.
                    This is the command that will be used to perform on-orbit updates of AFSW adjustable parameters.
command.name: read_cfg_file

argument.desc:
The angle, in degrees, to slew about the specified slew_axis_unit_vector.

            To hold the current commanded attitude, specify an angle of 0.0.
argument.name: slew_angle_deg

argument.desc: Three-float list (X, Y, Z) expected that specifies a slew axis in the body coordinate frame.
argument.name: slew_axis_unit_vector

command.desc:
Enable the ADCS to slew from the current commanded attitude of the spacecraft to a new attitude.

            The new attitude is defined by a relative slew about a body axis by some angle. At the end of the slew, the
            spacecraft will hold the new attitude.

            All go_to_hold commands will use EigenSlew, a slew time of 150 seconds, and disable momentum control
            (torque rods).
command.name: go_to_hold

command.desc:
Remove autonomous attitude control of the spacecraft as the attitude and rate errors are set to zero.

            Note: the attitude determination portion of the AFSW will continue to keep the attitude information up to
            date.

            Note: The momentum control state argument is NOT exposed to the ground (mission commands). Flight software
            internally manages the momentum control enabling/disabling based on the spacecraft mode. Momentum control
            is disabled in CHECKOUT mode.  It is enabled in all other modes.

            For example, when in CHECKOUT mode, if go_to_idle command is issued, momentum control is disabled (FSW
            autonomously sets the momentum control state argument to 0).  Similarly, if adcs is already commanded to
            idle and then the spacecraft is commanded to CHECKOUT mode, the momentum control will be disabled.
command.name: go_to_idle
command.response_desc: Current satellite attitude in ECI coordinates, and current value of control_momentum boolean.

argument.desc:
Ephemeris reference used to define remaining degree of freedom.

            If the spacecraft attitude has been fully acquired, the AFSW is in SunTrack, where the remaining degree of
            freedom is used to clock to this Ephemeris Reference. Otherwise, the AFSW is in SunAcq, which utilizes only
            measurements from the Sun sensors to align the panels to the Sun.
argument.name: ephemeris_reference

argument.desc: Three-float list (X, Y, Z) describing clocking unit vector in spacecraft body coordinate system.
argument.name: unit_vector

command.desc:
Orient the spacecraft solar panel to the Sun.

            Uses logic in GoToSunPoint FJ script.

            If attitude is not determined, the ADCS will perform Sun acquisition (search and converge on sun vector,
            no specific clocking) using the course and fine sun sensors (until ephemeris and attitude become
            determined). If attitude is determined, the ADCS will perform SunTracking with the specified clocking
            option/axis.
command.name: go_to_sun_point
command.response_desc: Current satellite attitude in ECI coordinates, and angle between +Y body axis and sun vector, in deg.

argument.desc:
Desired duration of the slew to the new attitude.

            If set to 0.0, or any other unachievable rate, vehicle performs a max-rate slew. Argument only enables a
            slew to be intentionally retarded below max-rate.
argument.name: slew_time_sec

argument.desc:
Type of slew to perform.

            Slew type affects minimum slew duration and settling performance.

            Body rate at the end of the slew is determined by AFSW based on the track_type (e.g. it will be zero when
            tracking inertial targets, but non-zero when tracking a ground_target).
argument.name: slew_type

argument.desc:
Track type which defines the primary satellite attitude objective.

            All track_type arguments except for InertialFixed leave one degree of freedom undefined (e.g. +Z axis
            tracking ground target with undefined azimuth). This third degree of freedom is defined by the
            ephemeris_reference and clocking_unit_vector.
argument.name: track_type

argument.desc: Ephemeris Reference used to define remaining degree of freedom.
argument.name: ephemeris_reference

argument.desc:
Three-float list (X, Y, Z) describing clocking unit vector in spacecraft body coordinate system.

            Default clocks +Y face to sun vector.
argument.name: clocking_unit_vector

command.desc:
Orient the spacecraft to a specific tracking mode and body clocking.

            Enable the ADCS to align a body vector to an EphemerisReference as defined by the track_type argument and
            clock a body vector to another specified EphemerisReference.

            Slewing is defined by the SlewType and slew duration.
command.name: go_to_track
command.response_desc: Current satellite attitude in ECI coordinates and SAP-defined pointing accuracy tolerance.

argument.desc: Image and communication targets have different tracking accuracy thresholds set by SAP.
argument.name: ground_target

argument.desc:
Three-float list (X, Y, Z) describing position of target on surface of WGS84 ellipsoid.

            WGS84 Ellipsoid: Geodetic Latitude in deg, Longitude in deg, and Elevation in meters above ellipsoid.
argument.name: geodetic_vector

command.desc:
Set the latitude (deg), longitude (deg), and altitude (m) coordinates of a specified GroundTarget object.

            Note: Does NOT track that target. Use go_to_track to start actively tracking the set_target.
command.name: set_target

argument.desc:
Desired duration of the slew to the new attitude.

            If set to 0.0, or any other unachievable rate, vehicle performs a max-rate slew. Argument only enables a
            slew to be intentionally retarded below max-rate.
argument.name: slew_time_sec

argument.desc:
Type of slew to perform.

            Slew type affects minimum slew duration and settling performance.

            Body rate at the end of the slew will be zero.
argument.name: slew_type

argument.desc:
Quaturnion defining the inertial attitude to align the spacecraft body with.

            The quaternion represents the scalar-last True of Date (TOD) to Body coordinate transformation for the
            desired spacecraft orientation in inertial space
argument.name: target_quaternion

command.desc:
Align the spacecraft body with a specified inertial attitude.

            Set the inertial attitude (True of Date to Body coordinate system rotation), and slew to orient to that
            attitude. If the target is moving relative to inertial space, it does NOT track that target. Use
            go_to_rso_track to actively track a resident space object.
command.name: go_to_inertial_point

argument.desc: Epoch (POSIX time) in seconds
argument.name: epoch

argument.desc:
RSO target position.

            Defined in the True of Date (TOD) Earth-centered inertial (ECI) coordinate system corresponding to the
            epoch argument.
argument.name: target_position

argument.desc:
RSO target velocity.

            Defined in the True of Date (TOD) Earth-centered inertial (ECI) coordinate system corresponding to the
            epoch argument.
argument.name: target_velocity

argument.desc:
Desired duration of the slew to the new attitude.

            If set to 0.0, or any other unachievable rate, vehicle performs a max-rate slew. Argument only enables a
            slew to be intentionally retarded below max-rate.
argument.name: slew_time_sec

argument.desc:
Type of slew to perform.

            Slew type affects minimum slew duration and settling performance.

            Body rate at the end of the slew is determined by the relative rate of the target RSO.
argument.name: slew_type

argument.desc: Ephemeris Reference used to define remaining degree of freedom.
argument.name: ephemeris_reference

argument.desc:
Three-float list (X, Y, Z) describing clocking unit vector in spacecraft body coordinate system.

            Default clocks +Y face to sun vector.
argument.name: clocking_unit_vector

command.desc:
Enable the ADCS to align the boresight to a Resident Space Object (RSO).

            The RSO to align with is defined by an ephemeris entry (Epoch, Position, Velocity) and clock a body vector
            to a specified ClockEphemOption.

            Note: Requires the ephemeris Epoch of the RSO target to be within +/- 1 hour.of the system time at which
            the command is executed. Otherwise the command is ignored. This is to avoid ephemeris propagation errors.

            Note: Requires ADCS to be using GPS-based ephemeris propagation. If an ephemeris table is active (i.e.
            ConfigureEphemeris running), the RSO tracking command is ignored. This is due to a limitation in the ADCS
            ephemeris propagation code.
command.name: go_to_rso_track

argument.desc:
Desired duration of the slew to the new attitude.

            If set to 0.0, or any other unachievable rate, vehicle performs a max-rate slew. Argument only enables a
            slew to be intentionally retarded below max-rate.
argument.name: slew_time_sec

argument.desc:
Duration to execute the dryout procedure.

            If set to 0.0, dryout rotations will continue indefinitely until another external command changes the ADCS
            mode.

            Note: the seconds here are a minimum. The dryout process does not necessarily end in
            dryout_duration_sec, since the current 360 deg rotation must have completed before we compare
            dryout_duration_sec to time elapsed.
argument.name: dryout_duration_sec

command.desc:
Execute the ADCS telescope dryout procedure.

            Commands ADCS to execute the RunTelescopeDryout FJ script which sequentially aligns 4 unique non-primary
            axes (45 deg off the Z-axis, 45 deg off each Z-adjacent side) to the Sun for a specified duration, while
            clocking the Z-axis NadirDetic. Duration of slews between 4 orientations is user-specified (or as fast as
            possible). Uses sunlight to dry a Z-pointing payload while avoiding the payload Sun keep-out-zone (up to 45
            deg).
command.name: run_telescope_dryout

argument.desc: Image and communication targets have different tracking accuracy thresholds set by SAP.
argument.name: ground_target

argument.desc:
Three-float (X, Y, Z) list describing a target on surface of WGS84 ellipsoid to start scan maneuver.

            WGS84 Ellipsoid: Geodetic Latitude in deg, Longitude in deg, and Elevation in meters above ellipsoid.
argument.name: starting_geodetic_vector

argument.desc:
Three-float (X, Y, Z) list describing a target on surface of WGS84 ellipsoid to end scan maneuver.

            WGS84 Ellipsoid: Geodetic Latitude in deg, Longitude in deg, and Elevation in meters above ellipsoid.
argument.name: ending_geodetic_vector

argument.desc:
Ground speed in meters per second.

            min/max values of 0/7200 from here:
            https://confluence.spaceflightindustries.com/display/SPP/ADCS+Flight+Software+Commands
argument.name: ground_speed_mps

command.desc:
Set the properties of a specified GroundTarget object for scanning but does NOT track that target.

            The properties include start point, end point, and ground speed. Use go_to_track to start actively tracking
            the set_target_scan.
command.name: set_target_scan

argument.desc:
Epoch timestamp of first orbital element entry. Used to construct
            the FlightJAS script that loads ephemerides.
argument.name: epoch

argument.desc:
Encoded future ECI positions (m) and velocities (m/s) to install.

            Used to construct the FlightJAS script that loads ephemerides.

            Generated by the following logic:

            1.  For all position and velocity double precision floats
                a.  Pack value into raw bytes (little-endian)
                b.  Remove least significant 3 bytes (from the fraction section
                    of the double precision float)
                c.  Add the remaining 5 bytes to a binary blob
            2.  Compress this blob into a z-standard archive (compression level
                19)
            3.  Encode this archive in Base64
argument.name: b64

command.desc:
Install the spacecraft's future Long Term Ephemeris (LTE) entries.

            Each entry is specified by the first epoch timestamp and the encoded orbital element data. The interval
            between entries is hardcoded to 1 hour.

            This generates a ConfigureEphemeris FJ script which will then be executed, replacing any existing
            ConfigureEphemeris FJ script that may have been running at the time.

            Note that this will be done without restarting the ADCS subsystem. The new script will also execute if the
            ADCS subsystem does restart (including satellite reboots).
command.name: set_ephem

command.desc:
Power on the propulsion device and allow it to gather telemetry into the telemetry stream.
             Does not allow the propulsion device to control any actuators including tank heaters.
command.name: prop_telem

command.desc:
Command the propulsion FSW mode (prop.fsw.mode) to Bakeout to perform the propulsion bakeout procedure.

             The bakeout procedure is defined in section 11.8 of the Comet-8000 Interface Control Document Rev 1.9.
             The propulsion FSW transitions prop.fsw.state to HeatingThruster, and heats the thruster core.
             Once the prop.core.thrusterTemp telemetry point reaches the prop.core.thrusterTemp.setPoint.bakeout, the
             propulsion FSW transitions prop.fsw.state to BakingOut. Testing on G4 characterized the duration in
             HeatingThruster state to be about 300 seconds going from a prop.core.thrusterTemp of 0 to 125 degrees
             Celsius.  Propulsion FSW remains in this state for a duration determined by the prop.fsw.bakeoutDuration
             SAP, after which time, the propulsion FSW disables the thruster heaters and transitions prop.system.state
             to Idle.  The propulsion FSW will remain in this state until the prop_poweroff Mission Command is
             executed.
command.name: prop_bakeout

argument.desc: Duration (in seconds) to remain in the prop.fsw.state of RegulatingPressure before transiting to HeatingThruster.
argument.name: pressure_regulation_duration_s

argument.desc: Duration (in seconds) to remain in the prop.fsw.state of HeatingThruster before transitioning to Thrusting.
argument.name: thruster_preheat_duration_s

argument.desc: Duration (in seconds) to remain in the prop.fsw.state of Thrusting before transitioning to Idle.
argument.name: thrust_duration_s

command.desc:
Command the propulsion FSW mode (prop.fsw.mode) to Thrust to perform a thrust maneuver.

             The propulsion FSW first transitions prop.fsw.state to RegulatingPressure to regulate the pressure in the
             propellant tanks. It remains in this state for a duration specified in the pressure_regulation_duration_s
             argument. Then FSW transitions prop.fsw.state to HeatingThruster to pre-heat the thruster to the
             prop.thrusterTemp.setPoint.heatingThruster SAP before thrusting. Note that the prop device control
             software continues to regulate tank pressure in this state. It remains in this state for a duration
             specified in the thruster_preheat_duration_s argument. Next, the FSW transitions prop.fsw.state to
             Thrusting which inhibits tank pressure regulation, increases the thruster heater set point to the
             prop.core.thrusterTemp.setPoint SAP.Thrusting, then causes the thrust valve to open. It remains in this
             state for a duration specified in the thrust_duration_s argument. Finally, the FSW transitions
             prop.fsw.state to Idle. The propulsion FSW will remain in this state until the prop_poweroff Mission
             Command is executed.
             NOTE: If this command is aborted for any number of reasons, the propulsion FSW will inihibit this command
             from being executed again until the prop_deinhibit Mission Command is executed.
command.name: prop_thrust

command.desc:
Command the propulsion FSW to cancel any command it is currently executing and power off the
             propulsion device.
command.name: prop_poweroff

command.desc:
Allow prop_thrust to be successfully executed again.

            If the propulsion FSW is currently being inhibited, this commands the propulsion FSW to
            allow prop_thrust to be successfully executed again.
command.name: prop_deinhibit

argument.desc: POSIX (00:00:00Z 1 Jan 1970) or CURRENT (current s/c time)
argument.name: time_reference

argument.desc: Time, in seconds, from specified epoch or time reference.
argument.name: time_offset_sec

command.desc: Adjust satellite time as an offset (positive or negative) from the specified epoch.
command.name: set_time
command.response_desc: Seconds elapsed since the POSIX epoch (00:00:00Z 1 Jan 1970)

argument.desc: Which reaction wheel: RW1, RW2, RW3, or RW4
argument.name: component_id

argument.desc:
0x00 -- Reset Reason
            0x01 -- Reset Count
            0x02 -- RS485_0 Framing Errors
            0x03 -- RS485_0 Runt Packets
            0x04 -- RS485_0 Oversize Packets
            0x05 -- RS485_0 Bad CRC
            0x06 -- RS485_0 Buffer Overflow
            0x07 -- RS485_1 Framing Errors
            0x08 -- RS485_1 Runt Packets
            0x09 -- RS485_1 Oversize Packets
            0x0A -- RS485_1 Bad CRC
            0x0B -- RS485_1 Buffer Overflow
            0x0C -- CAN_0 Framing Errors
            0x0D -- CAN_0 Runt Packets
            0x0E -- CAN_0 Oversize Packets
            0x0F -- CAN_0 Bad CRC
            0x10 -- CAN_0 Buffer Overflow
argument.name: diagnostic_channel

command.desc: Return error statistics.
command.name: get_wheel_diagnostic

argument.desc: Which reaction wheel: RW1, RW2, RW3, or RW4
argument.name: component_id

command.desc:
Set a specific reaction wheel to idle mode.

           Should only be called after calling go_to_idle while in CHECKOUT Mode.
command.name: idle_wheel

argument.desc: Which reaction wheel: RW1, RW2, RW3, or RW4
argument.name: component_id

command.desc: Calls WRITE FILE on a specific reaction wheel to set a specific EDAC address to a new value.
command.name: set_wheel_config_value

argument.desc: Which reaction wheel: RW1, RW2, RW3, or RW4
argument.name: component_id

argument.desc: rads/sec
argument.name: rw_rads_sec

command.desc:
Set a specific reaction wheel to a specific speed.

          Should only be called after calling go_to_idle while in CHECKOUT Mode.
command.name: set_wheel_speed

argument.desc: Which reaction wheel: RW1, RW2, RW3, or RW4
argument.name: component_id

argument.desc: Nm
argument.name: rw_torque

command.desc:
Set a specific reaction wheel to a specific torque.

          Should only be called after calling go_to_idle while in CHECKOUT Mode.
command.name: set_wheel_torque

argument.desc: 0 passed in will overwrite any previously commanded duration and revert back to 1hz now
argument.name: log_duration_sec

command.desc: Log telemetry at 20hz instead of 1hz
command.name: create_adcs_log
command.response_desc: The epoch start time of the 20hz data

argument.name: component_id

command.name: enter_imu_service_mode

argument.name: component_id

command.desc: Exit service mode to normal mode.
command.name: exit_imu_service_mode

argument.name: component_id

command.desc: Perform diagnostic.
command.name: perform_imu_diagnostic

argument.name: component_id

command.name: save_imu_configuration

argument.desc: Which IMU: IMU1 or IMU2
argument.name: component_id

argument.name: cmd_params_str

command.name: set_imu_serial_port_parameter

Changes made by this command may be autonomously and silently reverted if the subsequent call to
                    save_imu_configuration is not confirmed on the first attempt.

argument.desc: Which IMU: IMU1 or IMU2
argument.name: component_id

argument.desc: Refer to the ICD for what to pass to the 'f' command
argument.name: cmd_params_str

command.desc: Change LP filter cutoff frequency.
command.name: set_imu_low_pass_filter_freq

argument.desc: Path to the file
argument.name: file_path

argument.desc: key index to use to encrypt the file in space before sending it to ground
argument.name: key_index

argument.desc: hexlified string representing the initialization vector. spacecraft uses this to encrypt
argument.name: iv

argument.desc: Block size of single SFT packet in bytes.
argument.name: block_size

argument.desc: When TRUE the downlink is asynchronous and does not require or expect acknowledgement packets.
argument.name: use_async

argument.desc:
Limits bandwidth used by udpcast. Useful in asynchronous mode, or else the sender may send too fast for the switch
            and/or receiver to keep up. Bitrate may be expressed in bits per second (--bitrate 5000000),
            kilobits per second (--bitrate 5000k) or megabits per second (--bitrate 5m). This is the raw bitrate, including
            packet headers, forward error correction, retransmissions, etc. Actual payload bitrate will be lower.
argument.name: max_bitrate

argument.desc:
Sets forward-error correction (FEC) used by udpcast. This does NOT set the physical-layer Reed-Solomon
            coding on UHF downlink, which is set by the (non-spec) enable_uhf_fec command.
argument.name: fec

argument.desc: If TRUE allows receivers to join an ongoing transmission mid through.
argument.name: streaming

argument.desc: Starts transmission after n retransmissions of hello packet, without waiting for a key stroke.
argument.name: autostart

argument.desc: If not sent, this will default to full-duplex (contra udpcast's default)
argument.name: use_half_duplex

argument.desc: If set, rebroadcasts the HELLO packet used for initiating the casting each timeout milliseconds.
argument.name: rexmit_hello_interval_ms

argument.desc: If set, how many time to send a REQACK until dropping a receiver.
argument.name: retries_until_drop

argument.desc:
Sender aborts at start if it doesn't see a receiver within this many seconds.
            Once transmission is started, the timeout no longer applies.
argument.name: start_timeout_sec

command.desc:
Downlink file (may be split into multiple SFT packets if necessary) located at the specified path.

           Note: Files downlinked this way only have access to cmdseq-service's private tmp directory, so
           files created in /tmp by other services may not be downloaded with this command.
command.name: downlink_file
command.response_desc: Indicates whether udp-sender began correctly

argument.desc: Absolute path to the file
argument.name: file_path

argument.desc: key index to use to encrypt the file
argument.name: key_index

argument.desc:
String representing the initialization vector in hex.

          IV string length shall be even and have less than 32 chars (16 bytes).
          Spacecraft uses this to encrypt the file prior to conversion to encrypted SFT.
          The IV is prepended to encrypted file in clear prior encapsulation in an SFT packet which will be encrypted separately
argument.name: iv

command.desc:
Downlink a file with size less than 2K minus IV size located at the specified path.

           Note: Files downlinked this way only have access to cmdseq-service's private tmp directory, so
           files created in /tmp by other services may not be downloaded with this command.
command.name: downlink_file_as_sft
command.response_desc: Success indicates that a file is about to be sent as SFT packet

argument.desc: Absolute path to the file
argument.name: file_path

argument.desc: Populates the file_uid field of the SFX packet when slot is downlinked via downlink_file_slot.
argument.name: file_uid

command.desc:
Transfer a file to a slot on the PIC NAND.

           This command erases the contents of the provided slot ID, then writes the file to that slot. The file data
           may then be downlinked in one SFX packet using the `downlink_file_slot` command.

           Using this method of file transfer allows for more efficient use of ground-pass time by using the fast SFX
           downlink path instead of the lower bandwidth SFT path. The file may be generated and transfered to PIC NAND
           when convenient before the pass. The data trasnfer is performed by comms-service using the xband serial
           link, which may interfere with other comms-service functions during the transfer.

           The maximum file size is 44739200 bytes. The command completes in less than 90 seconds.

           The file size and provided file uid will be stored in the PIC nonvolatile memory and associated with the
           slot id. It is not necessary to provide them to the `downlink_file_slot` command.

           The PIC must be powered on and idle or the command will fail. The result of the command is printed to the
           system logs.
command.name: transfer_file_to_slot
command.response_desc: Success indicates that a file is about to be transfered to pic nand

argument.desc: key index field of sent SFX packet
argument.name: key_index

command.desc:
Downlink a slot on the PIC NAND containing file data.

           The slot must have been populated using transfer_file_to_slot. See the transfer_file_to_slot command for
           more information.
command.name: downlink_file_slot

argument.desc:
Signify that an intermediate master key is required.

          if customer_id = 0 then the master key will be used directly.
          If > 0, the customer_id will be used as the service_id to derive an intermediate master key
argument.name: customer_id

command.desc: Set the customer id to be used for the next downlinks.
command.name: set_customer_id
command.response_desc: Indicates command success

argument.desc: The key id.
argument.name: id

argument.desc: The key itself, encoded in B64 format.
argument.name: key

argument.desc: The key CRC.
argument.name: crc

command.desc:
Upload a new mission key. Mission keys can be used as alternate key
           when encrypting downlink_file_as_sft, downlink_image and and downlink_file_slot data.
command.name: upload_mission_key
command.response_desc:
Execution status of the command. The command is rejected if:
                     - The specified key id is incorrect
                     - The specified key has a wrong format
                     - The specified CRC does not match the key CRC

argument.desc: The key id.
argument.name: id

command.desc: Delete an existing mission key.
command.name: delete_mission_key
command.response_desc:
Execution status of the command. The command is rejected if:
                     - The specified key id is incorrect
                     - The specified key does not exist

argument.desc:
The id of the key to use. The key must be loaded with upload_mission_key before.
           The key id -1 selects the spacecraft master key.
argument.name: id

command.desc:
Select the specified mission key for the encryption of
           downlink_file_as_sft, downlink_image and downlink_file_slot commands.
command.name: select_mission_key
command.response_desc:
Execution status of the command. The command is rejected if:
                    - The specified key does not exist
                    - The CRC is incorrect.

argument.desc: Force old IV format if set to true
argument.name: old_format

command.desc:
Select the old IV format for for the encryption of
           downlink_file_as_sft sft packet, downlink_image and downlink_file_slot commands.
command.name: force_old_iv_format
command.response_desc: Execution status of the command.

argument.desc: Used in combination with a master key to generate an encryption key.
argument.name: downlink_key_index

command.desc: Downlink the specified image file over the X-band downlink.
command.name: downlink_image

command.desc: Erase PIC Image Slot.
command.name: erase_image

argument.desc: UP, DOWN, or BOTH
argument.name: direction

command.desc:
Stop any ongoing file transfers.

           The command is treated as successful even if there are no sessions to terminate.
command.name: kill_file_transfer
command.response_desc: Indicates what was canceled

argument.desc: Path to the file
argument.name: file_path

argument.desc: key index to use to decrypt the file once it is in space
argument.name: key_index

argument.desc: hexlified string representing the initialization vector, spacecraft uses this to decrypt
argument.name: iv

argument.desc:
Receiver aborts at start if it doesn't see a sender within this many seconds.
            Once transmission is started, the timeout no longer applies.
argument.name: start_timeout_sec

argument.desc:
Receiver aborts during transmission if it doesn't see a packet from the sender within this many seconds.
            This timeout only applies once transmission has started.
argument.name: receive_timeout_sec

argument.desc: If true, the FSW will try to decompress the file with zstd.
argument.name: is_compressed

command.desc: Uplink file (may be split into multiple SFT packets if necessary) and store it at the specified path.
command.name: uplink_file
command.response_desc: Indicates whether udp-receiver began correctly

argument.desc: Path to the file
argument.name: file_path

argument.desc: File content compressed into a z-standard archive and then encoded in Base64.
argument.name: file_data

command.desc: Uplink a small file with a single command and store it at the specified path.
command.name: uplink_file_as_sft
command.response_desc:
String describing the command execution result. Example responses:

                    SUCCEEDED uplink_file_as_sft: /var/sfs/maintenance/file.tmp

                    FAILED uplink_file_as_sft: InvalidArgument('File already exists.',)

The downlink band (aka channel, aka route, i.e. X-band vs. UHF).

argument.desc: One of the allowed spacecraft modes. see enum.SpacecraftMode.
argument.name: spacecraft_mode

command.desc: Transitions satellite to the commanded mode
command.name: change_mode
command.response_desc: Confirmation of mode change or error if already in that mode, or mode change not allowed

argument.desc: Path to the mission script file
argument.name: file_path

command.desc:
Execute mission script located at specified path.

          The mission script can be either a plain-text JSON file, or it can be compressed with Zstandard
command.name: execute_script
command.response_desc: Result of queueing script including noting if file not found or if script is in the past.

command.desc: Get the active Mission Script ID.
command.name: get_active_script_id
command.response_desc:
The 'script_id' field of the active script, or -1 if no script is active.

                   Example response: SUCCEEDED get_active_script_id: 153

argument.desc:
A string which selects the format of the command response.

        The command accepts two values: 'POSIX' and 'CURRENT'.

        POSIX: Time returned is 'Unix Time', or seconds from the epoch (00:00:00Z 1 Jan 1970).

        CURRENT: Time returned is relative to current s/c time
argument.name: time_reference

command.desc:
Get the time remaining in the current script.

          This time is computed by inspecting the script queue, with no consideration for command
          execution time or other delays.
command.name: get_script_time_remaining
command.response_desc:
The number of seconds, as a positive floating point value, until the last
                   command of the active Mission Script is executed, or an offset of zero if no
                   script commands are queued.

                   Example response: SUCCEEDED get_script_time_remaining: 23.60264825820923

argument.desc: Path to the file
argument.name: file_path

command.desc: Delete file at arbitrary path. Responds with path of deleted file.
command.name: delete_file
command.response_desc: Result of rm operation, plus a status on the available storage

command.desc: Stop writing to the current health log file and close it out.
command.name: flush_log
command.response_desc: Path to closed out log file, plus a status on the available storage

argument.desc: Unix timestamp
argument.name: start_time

argument.desc:
Unix timestamp.

            If you pass 4294967295 here then the spacecraft will interpret that to mean 'give me
            logs up to right now' with 'now' being the spacecraft's version of now at the time of
            command execution. The filename of the gathered log will contain this 'now' time, it will
            NOT contain 4294967295.
argument.name: end_time

command.desc: Search within log files to create file covering desired range.
command.name: gather_logs
command.response_desc: Path to prepared file, plus a status on the available storage

argument.desc: Unix timestamp
argument.name: start_time

argument.desc: Unix timestamp
argument.name: end_time

command.desc: Used to delete the log files created by the spacecraft, notably different from the ones created by Operators
command.name: delete_spacecraft_log_files
command.response_desc: Files deleted, plus a status on the available storage

argument.desc: Approximate time between consecutive telemetry packets.
argument.name: sec_between_packets

argument.desc:
Duration, in seconds, the stream should be in effect.

            0 means to turn off streaming now.
            This command only affects previously commanded streams. Beaconing is controlled separately via SAPs.
argument.name: enabled_duration_sec

command.desc: Stream telemetry packets at a specified period for a specified duration.
command.name: stream_telemetry

argument.desc: Duration, in seconds, that command should be in effect. 0 means to turn off streaming now.
argument.name: enabled_duration_sec

command.desc:
Begin streaming new syslog entries using SFT service ID REALTIME_SYSLOG.

           Syslog entries occuring after this command will emitted as an SFT packet.
command.name: stream_system_logs

command.desc: Stop the beacon
command.name: stop_beacon

command.desc:
Start periodic telemetry output (the beacon).

          The beacon is a single-packet transmission of telemetry. When active, it occurs at a
          SAP-defined frequency and is intended for us to hear proof-of-life from the spacecraft
          in the event of loss of commanding or nominal communications ability.

          The beacon is issued from the telemetry service on board the spacecraft, and it utilizes
          the same code as a nominal stream telemetry command does. Commanded streams take priority
          over autonomous beaconing, so if the spacecraft is streaming telemetry from a ground
          command, no beacon is sent.
command.name: start_beacon

command.desc: Respond and log a 'no-op' for troubleshooting testing.
command.name: no_op
command.response_desc: No-Op

argument.desc: verbatim message to stick into the system log
argument.name: message

command.desc: Print a message into the syslog. Used for marking operational intentions
command.name: log_message
command.response_desc: Ack

argument.desc: an (IP,Port) output address (typically '192.168.53.7,8006')
argument.name: transmit_addr

command.desc:
DEPRECATED

          Has no effect now as the command backchannel is always active. Kept for compatibility
          with existing tools.
command.name: open_cmdseq_side_door

argument.desc: Path to the already uplinked updated updates.toml file
argument.name: toml_file_path_str

argument.desc: Path to the already uplinked new command python file
argument.name: cmd_file_path_str

command.desc:
Update the updates.toml to load new commands from a new python file.

          Both must have already been uplinked.
command.name: update_toml
command.response_desc: Ack with script path if present

argument.desc: Case-sensitive name of SAP to be updated.
argument.name: sap_id

argument.desc:
All sap values will be stored as strings, then later interpretated as needed.
            If you are updating a boolean SAP, you *must* use 1 for True and 0 for False.
argument.name: new_sap_value

argument.desc:
The flight software image being updated. Use CURRENT to specify the currently booted image.

           In Checkout mode, use ALL to specify all images, including the non-booted ones.
argument.name: target_image

command.desc:
Stage an update of a SAP with the specified value.

           When updating a SAP on the booted image, the new value does not take effect until a
           commit_sap_updates command is executed. The new value is not written to non-volatile
           storage until a save_sap_updates command is executed for the image.

           When updating a SAP on a non-booted image, the new value is not written to the image
           until a save_sap_updates command is executed for the image.

           It is possible to clear the staged updates without committing/saving them by issuing the
           erase_pending_sap_updates command for a given image.
command.name: update_sap
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'sap_id': Mirror the 'sap_id' command argument
                     'new_sap_value': Mirror the 'new_sap_value' command argument
                     'target_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image
                     'old_sap_value': The value of the SAP before update, as it would be returned by the query_sap command (None when updating ALL images at once)

argument.desc: The flight software image being queried. Use CURRENT to specify the currently booted image.
argument.name: target_image

command.desc:
Print the staged SAP updates.

           Updates are staged with the update_sap command and cleared with the
           erase_pending_sap_updates command or by applying the updates with commit_sap_updates
           (for the booted image) or save_sap_updates (for non-booted images).
command.name: print_pending_sap_updates
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'target_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image
                     'pending_updates': The pending SAP updates, as a dictionary indexed by the name of each SAP being updated.
                                        Each item in the dictionary contains a 'value' entry with the value of the corresponding SAP

command.desc:
Creates a JSON document in /tmp/file_lists with all the active SAPs and their values.

            The document contains a single entry 'saps', a dictionary indexed by the name of each SAP.
            Each item in the dictionary contains a 'value' entry with the value of the corresponding SAP.

            Note that if called within a mission script, the satellite model on the ground may not have
            the correct expected file name. Use a list_files on that directory to be sure. See FSW-2652.
command.name: print_active_sap_values
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'result_file_path': The path to the side-effect file containing the active SAP values

argument.desc: The flight software image being queried. Use CURRENT to specify the currently booted image.
argument.name: target_image

command.desc:
Creates a JSON file in /tmp/file_lists with all the SAPs and their values which are saved to non-volatile memory.

            The document contains the following entries:
            'source_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image
            'saps': A dictionary indexed by the name of each SAP. Each item in the dictionary contains a 'value' entry with
                    the value of the corresponding SAP.

            Note that if called within a mission script, the satellite model on the ground may not have
            the correct expected file name. Use a list_files on that directory to be sure. See FSW-2652.
            Also note that even if this command returns a successful message, it will fail to create a file
            if the save_sap_updates Mission Command has never been called and no non-volatile SAPs files exist.
command.name: print_saved_sap_values
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'target_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image
                     'result_file_path': The path to the side-effect file containing the active SAP values

command.desc:
Commit the SAP updates staged for the booted image to the active database in volatile memory.

           This action clears all SAP updates staged for the booted image upon successful commit
           (like the erase_pending_sap_updates command would do).

           Until the save_sap_updates mission command is called, committed SAPs will be lost upon a
           panic, alarm or sap-service restart. If the save_sap_updates mission command is not
           called within a duration determined by the SapCommitTimeoutMinutes SAP, then sap-service
           will alarm the spacecraft after calling this to activate updated SAPs. Calling this
           command again will reset the SAP Commit Timeout timer to the current value of the
           SapCommitTimeoutMinutes SAP.
command.name: commit_sap_updates
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'num_committed_updates': The number of pending SAP updates that were committed

argument.desc: The flight software image being updated. Use CURRENT to specify the currently booted image.
argument.name: target_image

command.desc:
Clear the SAP updates staged with the update_sap command.

           For the booted image, staged SAP updates can be cleared up to the call to
           commit_sap_updates. To undo any SAPs that are committed but not saved with the
           save_sap_updates command, call the alarm_spacecraft mission command.

           For non-booted images, staged SAP updates can be cleared up to the call to
           save_sap_updates for the image.
command.name: erase_pending_sap_updates
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'target_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image
                     'num_erased_updates': The number of pending SAP updates that were cleared

argument.desc:
The flight software image being updated. Use CURRENT to specify the currently booted image.

           In Checkout mode, use ALL to specify all images, including the non-booted ones.
argument.name: target_image

command.desc:
Store all SAP values into non-volatile memory.

           For the booted image, this operation copies the active database from volatile memory into
           non-volatile memory. This means that desired SAP changes must be first committed through
           the commit_sap_updates operation. Attempting to execute the save_sap_updates command
           while updates are staged to the booted image results in an error.

           For non-booted images, this operation writes all the updates staged for the image
           directly into non-volatile memory, and clears the staged updates (like the
           erase_pending_sap_updates command would do).
command.name: save_sap_updates
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'target_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image

argument.desc: Case-sensitive name of SAP to be queried.
argument.name: sap_id

argument.desc: The flight software image being queries. Use CURRENT to specify the currently booted image.
argument.name: target_image

command.desc:
Return current value of the specified SAP.

           For the booted image, this value corresponds to the active value (in volatile memory).

           For non-booted images, this value is the one stored in non-volatile storage.
command.name: query_sap
command.response_desc:
A JSON document with the following entries:
                     'sap_id': Mirror the 'sap_id' command argument
                     'target_image': Mirror the 'target_image' command argument, also resolving the value CURRENT to the booted image
                     'sap_value': The current value of the SAP
                     For the booted image, the current value is defined as the active (volatile) value.
                     For non-booted images, the current value is defined as the saved (non-volatile) value.

argument.name: confirm

command.desc: Updates master key. Requires confirmation
command.name: update_master_key

argument.desc:
Percentage of duty cycle.

            Note: Battery heater power supply duty cycles are nominally commanded by flight software.
            Unless that functionality is disabled, the effects of this command may be over-ridden by software commands.
argument.name: power_supply_duty

command.desc: Sets the pulse-width modulation duty-cycle of a given non-essential bus power.
command.name: set_power
command.response_desc: Echo commanded duty cycle

argument.desc:
[0, 1] 1 = North end of a compass points in the positive direction. 0 = North end of a compass points in the negative direction.
            Note: Torque rod h-bridge polarity is nominally commanded by flight software.
            Unless that functionality is disabled, the effects of this command may be over-ridden by software commands.
argument.name: power_supply_polarity

argument.desc:
Percentage of duty cycle. Will be combined with power_supply_polarity above to map to [-1, 1] range.

            Note: Torque rod power supply duty cycles are nominally commanded by flight software.
            Unless that functionality is disabled, the effects of this command may be over-ridden by software commands.
argument.name: power_supply_duty

command.desc: Sets the pulse-width modulation duty-cycle and polarity of a given non-essential bus power.
command.name: set_h_bridge
command.response_desc: Echo commanded duty cycle and polarity

argument.desc: True turns on the power supply. False turns it off.
argument.name: enable_power

command.desc: Enables or disables a given non-essential bus power.
command.name: switch_power
command.response_desc: ack

argument.desc: True turns on the PIC card. False turns it off.
argument.name: enable_pic

argument.desc: True turns on the camera. False turns it off. If turning it on, enable_pic should also be set.
argument.name: enable_camera

argument.desc: True turns on the x-band radio. False turns it off. If turning it on, enable_pic should also be set.
argument.name: enable_xband

command.desc:
Turn on/off components related to the pic card: PIC, CAMERA, and X_BAND. Under nominal conops,
          this command should be used instead of switch_power because of interdependencies of these components. For example,
          x-band radio and camera should not be turned on until *after* pic card has been turned on and boot sequence is finished.
          See FSW-2150.
command.name: switch_power_pic
command.response_desc: ack

argument.desc: Name of the service to restart
argument.name: service_name

command.desc:
This is a command to wrap a systemctl call to restart a service. The available services are
            limited to services that are able to independetly restart without compromising the system's
            overall stability.
command.name: restart_fsw_service
command.response_desc: ACK

command.desc:
Send an 'Alarm' signal to health-service.

            This is referred to as a 'Soft Reset' in the requirements, and implemented in FSW via
            the internal 'Alarm' operation.

            Kills and restarts all Flight Software services. Other OS services, such as
            systemd-journald, are not restarted. Upon FSW restart, the S/C enters safe mode. This
            causes all external devices to be powered off. Devices are then powered on according to
            the defined Safe Mode Power State. If multiple Alarms are issued without the S/C
            leaving Safe Mode, the Alarm will escalate to a hard reset per a SAP value.
command.name: alarm_spacecraft
command.response_desc: ACK

command.desc:
Command the FCPU to perform an orderly OS shutdown and reboot.

             All FSW and OS services are stopped and non-volatile storage unmounted.
             Upon restart of the FCPU, OS services and FSW services are started.
             The S/C enters safe mode.
             Devices are then powered on according to the defined Safe Mode Power State.
command.name: reboot_flight_computer
command.response_desc: ACK

command.desc:
Send a 'Panic' signal to health-service.

            This is referred to as a 'Hard Reset' in the requirements, and implemented in FSW via
            the internal 'Panic' operation.

            FCPU sends a 'System Reset' command to the PCU.
            The PCU has a 5 second hold-off before the command is executed.
            During the hold-off, the FPCU performs an orderly OS shutdown and halt.
            When the hold-off expires, the PCU inhibits power to the Flight Computer and disables all NEB channels.
            The PCU holds the Flight Computer in reset for 3 seconds.
            The PCU then releases the power inihibit and allows the flight computer to power itself back up.
            Upon restart of the FCPU, OS services and FSW services are started.
            The S/C enters safe mode.
            Devices are then powered on according to the defined Safe Mode Power State.
command.name: panic_spacecraft
command.response_desc: ID of software service restarted

command.desc: Return version of flight software to verify configuration.
command.name: query_software_version
command.response_desc: Version of flight software

Read a camera register.

Write a value to a camera register.

Set camera exposure time in microseconds.

            Requires PIC to be turned on. Payload is passed to camera over its command interface.

            This command is required as part of imaging conops. Camera may be powered down between images. This setting will not be
            persisted over camera power cycles.

argument.desc: AOI window height in pixels
argument.name: v_height

argument.desc: AOI window vertical offset in pixels
argument.name: v_offset

command.desc:
Set camera AOI mode and parameters

            Requires PIC to be turned on. Payload is passed to camera over its command interface.

            The total number of pixels (h_width * v_height) must be a multiple of 16. All numeric parameters must be even.

            This command is required as part of imaging conops. Camera may be powered down between images. This setting will not be
            persisted over camera power cycles.
command.name: set_camera_aoi
command.response_desc: Outcome of the write

argument.desc: how long we will wait (max) for constraints to be met
argument.name: capture_timeout_ms

argument.desc: The UID associated with the file, helps identify the file upon encryption. Should be unique for each payload+key combo.
argument.name: file_uid

command.desc:
Capture image with payload camera.

            Constraints are evaluated when the camera is properly configured with the specified
            integration time and is ready for image capture. If constraints are met, the image is
            captured in sync with the next ADCS time-step so that the ADCS telemetry will be
            time-matched with the exposure. If constraints are not met and the capture_timeout is
            reached, the image will still be taken at that point.
command.name: capture_image

argument.desc:
Enable open-ended transfer to PIC volatile memory.

           Supported on block2-3+. When 'false', the command writes images to slots in PIC NAND. When 'true', the
           images are left in PIC RAM, allowing the command to complete earlier.

           capture_image_sequence may be called with 'more' unset to write images already in DDR to NAND.

           A maximum of 89 images may stored at once in PIC DDR.
argument.name: more

argument.desc:
Delay before image capture.

            For the first capture, how long to wait (max) for constraints to be met. For other captures, the delay
            between that capture and the previous capture.
argument.name: capture_delays_ms

argument.desc: The UID associated with the file, helps identify the file upon encryption. Should be unique for each payload+key combo.
argument.name: file_uids

argument.desc: Exposure time for each image. Set to zero for previous exposure time.
argument.name: exposures_us

command.desc: Capture images with payload camera.
command.name: capture_image_sequence

argument.desc: ST1 or ST2
argument.name: component_id

argument.desc:
Diagnostic Channel -- Function
            0x00 -- Reset Reason
            0x01 -- Reset Count
            0x02 -- Internal Framing Error Count
            0x03 -- Internal Runt Packet Count
            0x04 -- Internal Oversize Packet Count
            0x05 -- Internal Bad CRC Count
            0x06 -- Internal FIFO Overflow Count
            0x07 -- External Framing Error Count
            0x08 -- External Runt Packet Count
            0x09 -- External Oversize Packet Count
            0x0A -- External Bad CRC Count
            0x0B -- External FIFO Overflow Count
argument.name: diagnostic_channel

command.desc: Return error statistics.
command.name: get_star_tracker_diagnostic

argument.desc: ST1 or ST2
argument.name: component_id

command.desc: Primarily used to start a solution cycle, though there are other uses.
command.name: begin_star_tracker_solution_cycle

argument.desc: ST1 or ST2
argument.name: component_id

command.desc: Read one specific segment of the result structure.
command.name: read_star_tracker_result

argument.desc: ST1 or ST2
argument.name: component_id

command.desc: During next solution cycle save entire result structure to file. Required for on-orbit re-calibration.
command.name: save_star_tracker_result

argument.desc: check or fixup
argument.name: nand_op

argument.desc: ST1 or ST2
argument.name: component_id

command.desc:
Initiate Star Tracker NAND Check/Fixup.
           Operates on the specified Star Tracker's NAND flash
           The operation(s) are run in the background and take
           from 1 to 2 minutes to complete. During this time
           both Star Trackers are disabled.

           A report of the operation(s) is placed in the syslogs.

           If the specified operation is 'check'
               then only check ST-NAND
           If the specified operation is 'fixup'
               then first check ST-NAND,
               then run the fixup's as needed on ST-NAND,
               then check again to verify the fixup's were effective.
command.name: star_tracker_nand_ops

command.desc: Retrieve the anomaly report for the most recent alarm/panic/reboot.
command.name: get_anomaly_report
command.response_desc: Anomaly report

argument.desc: One of the allowed spacecraft modes. see enum.SpacecraftMode.
argument.name: spacecraft_mode

command.desc:
This power state should be the default nominal power state for any contact pass that utilizes XS communications.
          It does not include commands to track a groundstation.
command.name: set_xs_comms_power_state_no_track

argument.desc: One of the allowed spacecraft modes. see enum.SpacecraftMode.
argument.name: spacecraft_mode

argument.desc: Three-float list describing position of target on surface of WGS84 ellipsoid (Geodetic Latitude in deg, Longitude in deg, and Elevation in meters above ellipsoid).
argument.name: geodetic_vector

argument.desc:
Desired duration of the slew to the new attitude.

            If set to 0.0, or any other unachievable rate, vehicle performs a max-rate slew. Argument only enables a
            slew to be intentionally retarded below max-rate.
argument.name: slew_time_sec

argument.desc: Ephemeris Reference used to define remaining degree of freedom.
argument.name: ephemeris_reference

argument.desc: Three-float list (X, Y, Z) describing clocking unit vector in spacecraft body coordinate system. Default clocks +Y face to sun vector.
argument.name: clocking_unit_vector

argument.desc: What type of slew to use
argument.name: slew_type

argument.name: ground_target

argument.desc: Three-float list describing a target on surface of WGS84 ellipsoid to start scan maneuver (Geodetic Latitude in deg, Longitude in deg, and Elevation in meters above ellipsoid).
argument.name: starting_geodetic_vector

argument.desc: Three-float list describing a target on surface of WGS84 ellipsoid to end scan maneuver (Geodetic Latitude in deg, Longitude in deg, and Elevation in meters above ellipsoid).
argument.name: ending_geodetic_vector

argument.name: ground_speed_mps

EphemerisReference.InertialFixed: may be a unit vector, in ECI, when defined for clocking, or a quaternion when used for alignment or pointing
EphemerisReference.SC2NadirCentric: unit vector, in ECI, from spacecraft orbital position to the Geocentric sub-satellite point
EphemerisReference.SC2NadirDetic: unit vector, in ECI, from spacecraft orbital position to the Geodetic sub-satellite point
EphemerisReference.SC2Sun: unit vector, in ECI, from spacecraft orbital position to the Sun
EphemerisReference.SC2Tgt: unit vector, in ECI, from spacecraft orbital position to a Target Object
EphemerisReference.SCMagfield: unit vector, in ECI, of Earth magnetic field at spacecraft orbital position
EphemerisReference.SCVelocity: unit vector, in ECI, along spacecraft inertial velocity
EphemerisReference.TgtNormal: cross product of SC2Tgt and SCVelocity
EphemerisReference.TrueNorth: unit vector, in ECI, along true North at the Geodetic sub-satellite point

FswImage.ALL: A special value only available in Checkout mode for update_sap and save_sap_updates
FswImage.CURRENT: The currently booted image. This value is resolved on the spacecraft to one of FSW1, FSW2 or GOLDEN

GroundTarget.CommTarget: communication, i.e. ground station, targets have relatively loose pointing error constraints
GroundTarget.ImageTarget: image targets have tight pointing error and smear constraints

PowerHBridge.TQX: torque rod nominal dipole aligned along X-axis
PowerHBridge.TQY: torque rod nominal dipole aligned along Y-axis
PowerHBridge.TQZ: torque rod nominal dipole aligned along Z-axis

RWComponent.RW1: reaction wheel located in the -X, -Y corner of the satellite
RWComponent.RW2: reaction wheel located in the +X, -Y corner of the satellite
RWComponent.RW3: reaction wheel located in the +X, +Y corner of the satellite
RWComponent.RW4: reaction wheel located in the -X, +Y corner of the satellite

STComponent.ST1: star tracker boresight has component in the +X direction
STComponent.ST2: star tracker boresight has component in the -X direction

SlewType.EigenSlew:
A slew maneuver to change spacecraft orientation. The maneuver is a trapezoidal maneuver about the Eigen-axis
                (cross product of start and end pointing vectors). The command starts and ends with zero body rate
SlewType.RendezSlew:
A slew maneuver to change spacecraft orientation from any attitude and rate state to any other.
                 The maneuver forms a optimal polynomial trajectory to arrive at a specified attitude and rate state.

SwitchComponent.RW1: reaction wheel located in the -X, -Y corner of the satellite
SwitchComponent.RW2: reaction wheel located in the +X, -Y corner of the satellite
SwitchComponent.RW3: reaction wheel located in the +X, +Y corner of the satellite
SwitchComponent.RW4: reaction wheel located in the -X, +Y corner of the satellite
SwitchComponent.ST1: star tracker boresight has component in the +Y direction
SwitchComponent.ST2: star tracker boresight has component in the -Y direction

TimeReference.CURRENT: time offset should be with respect to the current system time
TimeReference.POSIX: time offset should be with respect to the POSIX epoch of (00:00:00Z 1 Jan 1970)

TrackType.InertialPoint: align body frame with specified InertialFixed vector, i.e. [0 0 0 1] rotation quaternion in scaler-last form
